I came back to the greatest minecraft series on this platform after hearing the news today, and I find myself almost forgetting that it all happened. Nothing has had time to sink in. Across many accounts and over many years Ive watched Techno go from 2k to 2m, to 10m. This mans amazing humor and personality carried me from elementary to high school, and always made me feel better when my own life got rough. If I look back through the years, even to the days of the Blitz parody, Techno has a place in my life in every time period and every one of those years, and was truly a source of comfort. We love you Technoblade, and well always be here. Rest in peace, and thank you for all the years.

It is actually fitting that an actual Samoan-born player, Stephen Crichton, clinched the win! Only two players were born in Apia, Stephen Crichton and Kelma Tuilagi. The rest were born in NZ and Australia. So let us all just appreciate and praise the Samoan Heritage! Let us not overdo the "a tiny little dot in the middle of the pacific" talk like Matt Parish did. We all know all the players speak English with either an Australian or NZ accent... they're not Tagata Māo‘i out there harvesting taro, bananas, breadfruit, and fish for their respective villages. It is a proud moment for those with Samoan Heritage regardless of where in the world you are, and I will be barracking for Samoa when they play the Kangaroos (and I pray that the officials, esp. the bunker, don't spoil it),

The crisis in the British game continues. The humiliation of GB in PNG, the decline in quality and financial problems in Super League, only England getting out of the groups but regularly losing against tier one and high tier two opposition… where is the game going? The Samoans play with flare and passion but the Aussies are a machine - should be a really good game.

Very disappointed with the Match Officials for their obvious cultural biassed decision making against the Samoans. A inocuous vertical lift which resulted in a 10 minute rest for Junior Paulo followed by an actualy serious injury to the spine of a Samoan player when an English player did a crusher tackle on him, the result was only a penalty against the English player. The offense should have resulted in a more serious sanction including a time in the bin. Then the Junior Paulo late charge on an English player who decided to do a Soccer player theatrics with a wee bump off by Junior when he was already committed to the tackle and was merely attempting to retract from the contact but his large mass of a Prop couldnt stop his momentum from making contact with the kicker, the Referee should have ignored the English players theatrics and milking it for all its worth....The result was an 8pt try bringing the English back into the game.....Samoa were almost robbed of their victory because of the Australian Referee's very biassed Refereeing decisions. An 8pt try nearly cost Samoa the game....the 10 minutes sin bin for the inocuous vertical upending of the English player should only have been a penalty because he was brought down safely. The crusher tackle was by far more serious and could subject the player to a more serious spinal injury in which the English player was only penalised for it...He should have been sent from the field for malicious intent. There is a need to review the quality of Referees officiating games, even the NRL have doush bags and this Bloke is one of the biggest doush bags around. We need more Pacific Islander Referees in the world cup. There is too many cultural biassed officialdom that needs to be stamped out. Such biassed officialdom historically has costed many Pacific Island Nations sorely in game results and it needs to be changed. We need unbiassed and culturally neutral officials.
